6. “Far from it”—-the second part of the reply, in which he rejects the conclusion with abhorrence.-‘ Far be it from me that I should think or teach that it is unjust in God to punish our unrighteousness, lying, and unbeliefi’ ‘⁴ Else how shall God be the judge of the world ?”—the third part of the reply, containing a proof of the negative of the proposition from the received and common testimony concerning God.
